intro: Threshold tBTC is a decentralized wrapped Bitcoin token on Solana backed by a threshold signature scheme. Despite its decentralized backing mechanism, the Solana token representation maintains centralized mint and update authorities.

risk_factors: Has mint authority - tokens can be minted

authority_analyses.mint_authority: AuthorityAnalysis(address='111wQfXaC7e7paLGoKqp2KnfZPEd3nZV8Yrw2KQ1oZ', authority_type='Non-existent', capabilities=['Address does not exist'], multisig_info=None, governance_info=None, risk_assessment={'risk_level': 'high', 'reason': 'Invalid authority address'})
authority_analyses.update_authority: AuthorityAnalysis(address='2PfR3xUdMS8xHUhE9H47dy2Ro3Ww9agP5GdnNoKj3Vtf', authority_type='Wallet', capabilities=['Full unilateral control (no multi-party approval required)'], multisig_info=None, governance_info=None, risk_assessment={'risk_level': 'high', 'reason': 'Single wallet control - centralized authority', 'mitigations': []})

recommendations: Consider decentralizing mint_authority - current setup is high risk
Consider decentralizing update_authority - current setup is high risk
